info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:52AM EDT until June 09 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MADISON...NORTHEASTERN PAGE AND WEST CENTRAL RAPPAHANNOCK COUNTIES... At 1252 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Luray, or 14 miles southeast of Woodstock, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Luray, Sperryville, Fairview, Kimball, Five Forks, Compton, Panorama, Skyland, Fourway and Rileyville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
